channel.title: Sugar Creek Baptist Church Video Podcast
channel.googleplay:author: Tim Stanley
channel.description: Sugar Creek is a church passionate about life change. It happens not because of the programs we have or the events we put on, but because the spirit of God is at work here. Join us for our Sunday morning messages.
channel.itunes:author: Sugar Creek Baptist Church
channel.itunes:subtitle: Sugar Creek Baptist Church Video Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: Sugar Creek is a church passionate about life change. It happens every day here – marriages healed, families revived, love restored, the hurting comforted. It happens not because of the programs we have or the events we put on, but because the spirit of God is at work here. He is the only one who can change a life and He wants to change yours for the better.
channel.itunes:author: Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Living Out What We Believe
item.description: The Church We Choose To Be. Part 5 – Living Out What We Believe (Revelation 2:12-17) In this series, we continue to delve into the profound messages of the seven churches in the Book of Revelation and reflect deeply on the encouragements and warnings given to these early congregations and consider how they apply to us today.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, revelation
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: An Unwavering Commitment to God’s Word
item.description: The Church We Choose To Be. Part 4 – An Unwavering Commitment to God’s Word (Revelation 2:18-29) Even though we don’t like suffering, we can’t avoid it. Because we live in an imperfect world, suffering is a part of life, and in this world, we cannot escape it. This message will focus on what God teaches about suffering and how the Bible equips us to navigate the difficult seasons of life from God’s perspective. We will learn that because of Jesus’s accomplishment on our behalf, we do not have to fear suffering. Instead, we can embrace it as one of the means God uses to help us become who He created us to be and to prepare us for eternity with Him.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, revelation
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Learning to Love "Those People"
item.description: Agree to Disagree Agreeably. Part 2 – Learning to Love “Those People” Join us as we journey into biblical wisdom and unravel the secrets to resolving disagreements with grace and integrity. Discover how to honor God while inspiring others through the transformative power of conflict management. Unlock the keys to fostering unity amidst diversity and turning discord into a catalyst for deeper understanding and connection. Don’t miss this dynamic journey toward peaceful resolutions and enriched relationships!

item.title: Rules of Engagement
item.description: Jesus & Politics. Part 2 – Rules of Engagement (Mark 12:13-17), with special guest Libin Abraham. We are all navigating a season where politics can increase anxiety, cause concern, and even fracture relationships. Politics seems to divide the world and may even threaten to divide the church. However, the church of Jesus was built to shine and bear witness of an entirely different kingdom in moments like this. Jesus and the early church showed us how to navigate earthly politics as citizens of heaven. During this two-week series, special guest, Libin Abraham, will explore together from the life and teachings of Jesus how we remain united in our posture, biblical in our convictions, and loving in our engagement.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, government
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

Don't miss this enlightening discussion that promises to deepen your faith and expand your perspective on the intersection of spirituality and civic responsibility.

item.title: Michael Jr.
item.description: RE-ENGAGE. Keys to a Better Marriage. Part 3 – Michael Jr. Known as one of today’s most gifted communicators, Michael Jr brings laughter and encouragement to audiences all over the world. Using comedy and dynamic storytelling heinspires audiences to discover and activate their purpose. This unique skill set haslanded himon stages like The Tonight Show on NBC, TEDx talks and Jimmy Kimmel Live. His mission to make laughter commonplace in uncommon places means that he also seeks opportunities to share his gift with those in homeless shelters and prisons. You can find him in Sony Pictures’ feature film War Room, as well as starring roles in Selfie Dad, Laughing on Purpose, and More Than Funny.

item.title: Giving Ourselves Away
item.description: Worship Is... Part 3 – Giving Ourselves Away (Isaiah 6:1-8) Look at any culture of any generation as far back as human civilization has existed, and you will find worship. It is as though the need to worship was built into the human DNA. From the beginning mankind knew God existed. Adam walked with God. Overtime, WHO God is got confused but THAT He is has always been a part of humanity. Worship is a part of understanding God, engaging with Him and expressing our love and commitment to Him. Worship is a way of giving back to the One who gave us life. In our series we will explore the Biblical way of worship; how to better prepare to encounter God and how to express our worship through making Him known.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, worship
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.description: Healing Broken Relationships. Part 2 – To Bitterness and Back (Ephesians 4:30-32) (Ephesians 4:25-30) We all rely on others, as it's how God made us. But sometimes these relationships can be challenging, and the feeling may be mutual. In this 4-part series, we'll explore how to mend friendships when they break. We'll discuss improving our communication and reactions for better relationships, understanding why relationships break and how to restore them, ultimately fostering love and selflessness in our lives.

item.title: What Mature Faith Looks Like
item.description: Trust Issues: Trusting God in Real Life. Part 6 – What Mature Faith Looks Like (Hebrews 11:32-40) Join us for an engaging sermon inspired by Hebrews 11. We’ll tackle the challenge of doubt head-on and explore practical ways to overcome it. Dive into the ageless wisdom of the Bible and learn how to boost your faith, even when life gets uncertain. Don’t miss out on this chance to strengthen your spiritual core and rediscover hope on your faith journey.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, trust

item.title: Standing Alone With Faith
item.description: Trust Issues: Trusting God in Real Life. Part 5 - Standing Alone With Faith (Genesis 6) Standing alone with our faith can be difficult. This Sunday we will look at the life of Noah. Noah’s faith was unwavering and exceptional. In a world engulfed in wickedness, he found favor with God. When instructed to build an ark for an impending flood, he followed God’s guidance, enduring mockery, and ridicule from others. His faith in God’s promise sustained him throughout the long and challenging process of constructing the ark. Noah’s story underscores the power of faith, obedience, and trust in divine providence, ultimately leading to the salvation of his family and Earth’s creatures.

item.title: The Faith Habit
item.description: Trust Issues: Trusting God in Real Life. Part 3 – The Faith Habit (1 Samuel 17) It is important that we pay close attention to our habits because we give much of our life to them, much more than we probably realize. And when we acquire harmful habits, the damage is incalculable for us and even for those around us. To combat bad habits, it is necessary to replace them with good habits. And there is one in particular that will make a huge difference in our lives. Join us to hear the answer.

item.title: What Faith Is And How To Get It
item.description: Trust Issues: Trusting God in Real Life. Part 2 – What Faith Is And How To Get It (Hebrews 11:1-6; Selected Scriptures) Biblical trust is not presumption; it is not walking on thin ice, going out on a limb or doing something crazy. Trust is not wishful thinking, or even positive thinking. Trust is believing in a promise God has made to me. When I believe in a promise God has made and I act on it, my trust guarantees that I will get it.

item.title: Being a Church that Gives Back to God
item.description: Love, Lead, and Life Change. Part 4 – Being a Church that Gives Back to God (I Corinthians 16:1-2) God had a dream God had a dream when He gave birth to Sugar Creek 48 years ago. He wanted to make the greatest impact in the lives of people regionally and around the world using us at Sugar Creek to do so. He gave us a purpose to love and lead all people to life change in Christ. We quote that powerful purpose statement every Sunday. But what does that mean and what does God expect from us as we live out that call? We are exploring God’s dream for us and the power that drives this church in our short series: Love, Lead and Life-Change.

item.title: The Power of Control
item.description: Power Living. Part 3 – The Power of Control (Ephesians 5:18-21) All of us want more control over our life. To be the master of our destiny. That’s why we do everything in our power to forge our dreams. But in a world that strives for more control, we see more people lose it – including ourselves. No wonder stress, worry, and anxiety only continue to increase. But what if we’ve been going about this the wrong way? What if struggling for more control is a losing battle, and there is a better way? In this message, we will look at the biblical principle of control and how you can make the best decision for your life. Don’t miss it!

item.description: Answered Prayer: How To Get What You Prayed For. Part 4 – What To Do When God Is Silent (Luke 1:5-24) Answered prayer is a powerful and transformative experience that deepens our faith and connection with God. When we approach Him in heartfelt sincerity, He hears our petitions and responds according to His perfect wisdom and timing. Answered prayer reveals God’s faithfulness, love, and involvement in our lives. It strengthens our trust in Him and provides reassurance that He is actively working on our behalf. In this series, we gain a deeper understanding of how His answers propels us forward, ignites our faith, and empowers us to step boldly into the fulfillment of His promises.

item.title: I Am Powerful In Christ
item.description: Who Am I? Part 6 – I Am Powerful In Christ (Ephesians 1:19-23). Everyone is on a journey sooner or later to find themselves; to understand who God made them to be. This current culture makes a big emphasis on self-discovery but makes race, sexuality and gender at the center of the pursuit. It purposely pits us against each other with intended winners and losers. It demands capitulation or punishment. The Bible also makes self-discovery an important part of its message to us. Unsurprisingly, its criteria is totally different than this confused culture.

item.title: This Changes Everything
item.description: Who Am I? Part 1 – This Changes Everything (Ephesians 1:1-6) Everyone is on a journey sooner or later to find themselves; to understand who God made them to be. This current culture makes a big emphasis on self-discovery but makes race, sexuality and gender at the center of the pursuit. It purposely pits us against each other with intended winners and losers. It demands capitulation or punishment. The Bible also makes self-discovery an important part of its message to us. Unsurprisingly, its criteria is totally different than this confused culture. Its goal is to show us how to live with relationship, confidence, conviction and acceptance. We begin a six-session journey of discovery together. Our guide will be an amazing chapter hidden in plain sight – Ephesians 1. You will be forever enriched with God’s answer to the question – Who Am I?

item.title: What Does God Want?
item.description: REVIVE : Minor Moment, Major Movement, Part 4 – What Does God Want? (Micah) For ages, hearts have begged the question, “What does God want from us?” This is the question asked in Micah 6:6. Man suggests faithless actions, superfluous gifts, and senseless sufferings. The prophet proclaims that God has made his requirements known. We simply need to act justly, love mercy, and walk humbly with our God. A simple outline of a life completely submitted to God.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus,minor,prophet,micah
item.itunes:author: Xaviere Maryland

item.title: Smarter Not Harder
item.description: REVIVE : Minor Moment, Major Movement, Part 3 – Smarter Not Harder (Haggai) We tend to think that if we work hard and give our best in what we do, we can accomplish what we want and find the satisfaction we long for. However, many people have achieved more than they ever thought they would and still feel void and frustrated. In the book of Haggai, God teaches us that true satisfaction comes in what we would consider a paradoxical way, not necessarily by working harder but by being wiser. In this sermon and through the teaching of this prophet, we will discover how prioritizing the right thing will produce the results we long for.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus,minor,prophet,jonah
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: The Selfie Life
item.description: REVIVE : Minor Moment, Major Movement, Part 2 – The Selfie Life (Jonah) We live in an age where our society is geared towards a “me” mentality. Whether we realize it or not, we are all being shaped to look out only for ourselves. It’s all around us – in our social media, Amazon orders, or curbside service, we believe others are here to cater to our needs. Even Christ-followers think of God being here for what they want by saying, “Lord, bless me.” “Lord, promote me.” or “Lord, give me.” God becomes sort of a means to an end. This was the story of the famous prophet Jonah. And in his walk with God, he was taught that a life devoted to God is not about us but serving Him and others. Join us for this message to learn how to avoid the dangers of the selfie life.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus,minor,prophet,jonah
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: Return to Me
item.description: REVIVE : Minor Moment, Major Movement, Part 1 - Return to Me (Malachi 1:1-4:6) The book of Malachi is the last book in the Old Testament and it contains a series of messages from God to the people of Israel. The message of Malachi is relevant to our lives today in several ways. First, it reminds us of God’s love for us and the importance of obeying His commandments. Second, it warns us of the consequences of sin and calls us to repentance. Finally, it points us to the coming of Jesus Christ as our Savior and the importance of preparing for His return.

item.title: Discern, Discover, Determine, and Decide
item.description: Discern, Discover, Determine, and Decide (Acts 8:26-40) We often hear that we are called to share our faith with others. However, fear of rejection, a sense of inadequacy, and the business of life often keep us from doing what we are called to do. In this message, you will study a story in the Bible that teaches us how we can use everyday conversations and connections with people around us to point them to the one who can give them hope, Jesus Christ. We will examine how these four verbs can help us live every day with intentionality.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, success

item.title: The First Words
item.description: The First Words (Matthew 25:14-30) As the New Year arrives, we look at our lives and wonder what we need to do to be more successful. But, if we’re honest, we shouldn’t settle with having a successful year but work towards a successful life. How will this year help us accomplish that? In this message, we will look at a familiar biblical story to find a key principle to help us live a life that truly will make a difference.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, success

item.title: Christmas Is...
item.description: CHRISTMAS IS… the most wonderful time of the year. Family and friends get together and hearts are merry. Children are in wonder and expectation. It is a time filled with bright lights, beautiful decorations, and the delightful sounds of joy. How did this season come to be? Christmas is…about a baby born whose single life changed the world for good. More than anyone else who was ever born, Jesus changed the world for good. Christmas is… promise, presence, and peace.

item.title: Encountering God In His Mission
item.description: Encountering God Day by Day, Part 5 – Encountering God In His Mission (Acts 1:6-11) Why do so many struggle to focus on what is in front of them and potentially miss out on the bigger plan God has for us? In the bible, we find several people God used powerfully, but before they experienced God in those mighty ways, they had to be reminded of the bigger picture. That included Jesus’ disciples. We will study this in the last conversation Jesus had with them.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, encounter, life change, faith
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: Let The Bible Change You
item.description: Encountering God Day by Day, Part 4 – Let The Bible Change You. God has promised to always be with us, yet we quickly forget His constant presence in our lives. It is easy to get distracted by the continuous demands of our everyday lives and be unaware that God is there, even in the mundane or the difficult. The good news is that the Creator of the universe loves to be close to us and desires that we know Him more deeply. If you long to encounter God daily, join us for this series to explore practical ways to be closer to Him and make His presence known more firmly in your life.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, encounter, life change, faith
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Prayer Matters
item.description: Encountering God Day by Day, Part 2 – Prayer Matters (Matthew 7:7-11) If our prayers matter, why are so many opposed to praying? And even more so, why do so many people struggle to pray every day? Christians and non-Christians alike seem to have this issue. In the second part of this series, we will explore why prayer matters and how it can change the way you view it and do it.
item.itunes:keywords: sugar, creek, baptist, god, bible, christ, christianity, jesus, encounter,life change,prayer
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: Begin At The Throne

item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Our Mission, Who Is Your One?
item.description: Our Rescue. Part 4 – Our Mission, Who Is Your One? (Matthew 28:16-20) We have an innate desire to live for something greater. We want to make an impact and know that our life matters. God placed that need in our hearts because He designed us with a purpose. He has given us a mission. Discover that God’s rescue plan comes with an invitation to make an eternal impact in the lives of those around us and across the world. He invites us to be a part of His plan of Rescue.
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: What Now?
item.description: Our Rescue. Part 3 – What Now? (2 Cor 5:17, 1 Peter 2:21) Life is full of changes. Some are good and some are not so good, but the reality is that change is part of life. One of the highest values we have here at Sugar Creek is life change. It is in our purpose statement - Our purpose is to love and lead all people to LIFE CHANGE in Christ. We believe that when Jesus Christ takes hold of a person’s life He changes that person from the inside out.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: God’s Solution
item.description: Our Rescue. Part 2 – God’s Solution (1 Cor 15:1-4; Acts 2:32-36) Last Sunday we saw who the Bible says we, as human beings, were created to be. We also saw what went terribly wrong between us and God. What in the world do we now do? Even before God created the universe, He knew this was coming and already determined how He would rescue and restore us. We will see the great plan and provision of God for us and for all humanity.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: What Went Wrong
item.description: Our Rescue. Part 1 – What Went Wrong (Genesis 1:26-27, Romans 5:12-14) What went wrong in our world that led to us needing Jesus to rescue us? Sin came into the world through one man, and death through sin, and so death spread to all men because all sinned. In order for us to understand what went wrong we have to look at God’s plan for creation in the original story and see why Jesus needed to come.
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: Three in One
item.description: The God Who Loves Me. Part 4 – Three in One. There are times in our lives when we struggle, when we are full of anxiety, of fear, of hopelessness. What if there was someone in our life who was there, who cared for us, who had the power to give us genuine hope, even in the midst of all we go through? There is someone. The Bible identifies Him as the God of the universe, and He loves us deeply. He is our Heavenly Father, Who cares for us. He is the Son of God, Who took our place. He is the Holy Spirit, Who lives inside of us and is our daily Helper. All three are expressions of the One True God. Let’s meet with this God exactly where we are and try to better know The God Who Loves Me.
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: See God As Your Source
item.description: See God As Your Source (2 Kings 5:1-14; 2 Kings 4:1-7) Pastor Mark Hartman reminds us that God is indeed the source of all we have and why we should give back in return.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: What’s In It For Me?
item.description: Finding My Place at Sugar Creek. Part 3 – What’s In It For Me? Matthew 20:26 says, Whoever wants to become great must be a servant of others. The more you humble yourself to serve others the greater you become. Deep inside all of us there is a deep desire to make our lives count, to move beyond self-centered to significance. So, what are you going to do with your life? You really only have three alternatives. You can spend your life. You can waste your life. Or you can invest your life. Everyday our life is full of normal mundane tasks and interactions. This week we look at how mastering these moments leads to a fulfillment of purpose for our life.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Leave A Legacy
item.description: Finding My Place at Sugar Creek. Part 2 – Leave A Legacy - (Eph 4:15-17) Matthew 20:26 says, Whoever wants to become great must be a servant of others. item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.description: Finding My Place at Sugar Creek. Part 1 – What Am I Here For? (Matthew 25:14-30) Matthew 20:26 says, Whoever wants to become great must be a servant of others. item.title: Mastering the Mundane
item.description: The Land Between, Part 3 – Mastering the Mundane (1 Samuel 16:11-13) Everyday our life is full of normal mundane tasks and interactions. This week we look at how mastering these moments leads to a fulfillment of God’s purpose for our life.
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: When Fear Kicks In
item.description: The Land Between, Part 2 – When Fear Kicks In (1 Kings 19:1-18) Because we live in an imperfect world, all of us face difficult situations that get us off balance. Those difficult situations tend to result in fear and when fear kicks in, we tend to ask God to take the situation away or to at least alleviate the pain. But many times, this doesn’t happen as fast as we would like. In this message, we will learn that there is a better way to respond to fear and that God can use the fearful situations in our lives for our good.
item.itunes:author: Ender Palencia

item.title: The Land Between, Part 1
item.description: The Land Between, Part 1 (Numbers 11:4-6, 11-23) I’m sick of living in this apartment.” “I’m sick of this job. I hate my boss. I’m sick of not knowing what’s wrong with me. I just wish the doctor would tell me what’s going on.” The Land Between is that place where we don’t have the answers, where we can complain and experience a meltdown but it also is a place to see God’s provision and transformation power in our lives. On Sunday, we will look at a group of people and what they experienced in the Land Between.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: The Rhythms of Jesus
item.description: Special Guest, Libin Abraham; The Rhythms of Jesus. In the midst of life’s numerous demands and pressures, it’s very possible that the rhythms of our soul can become off kilter. The pace of our life can lead to exhaustion or burn out. However, though his mission was great and his earthly years short, Jesus lived a centered and unhurried life. Jesus modeled certain rhythms of life through which he invites us into the unforced rhythms of his grace. I believe that this message will help recalibrate your heart to God’s divine tempo for life.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Preserving Our Freedom of Religion
item.description: REFOCUS: Viewing Morality Through God’s Eyes. Part 8 – Preserving Our Freedom of Religion (Psalm 126:2-3) In a fuzzy environment, we all need corrective lenses to see clearly. Without them, reality will always look distorted. The same is true about the many moral issues in the world. What is the right way to see them? How are we to live our lives and how are we to treat others? While the world offers us lenses from a variety of perspectives such as social media influencers, political parties, entertainment celebrities and news outlets, there really is a better option. The God who created the universe gave us His Word which tells us how He made mankind and how He wants us to live.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Why Believe The Bible?
item.description: REFOCUS: Viewing Morality Through God’s Eyes. Part 2 – Why Believe The Bible? (2 Timothy 3:16) The Bible is not a science book, or an archaeology or history book, but when it speaks scientifically, archaeologically, or historically it is without error. I have heard some say, Science has proven the Bible wrong on many points. Really? On what points? Science has said it is wrong many times and then has had to come back red-faced when more evidence was uncovered which proved science wrong and the Bible right.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: The Influence of Character
item.description: DANIEL: STANDING STRONG. Part 7 – The Influence of Character (Daniel 6) Our world is facing an unbelievably difficult time of distress and confusion. We are emerging from a two year worldwide pandemic and now are facing, at least the possibility, of a worldwide war. All the while there is a culture war that challenges our Biblical morals. Jesus said in the last days the world would be in a state just like this. The Book of Daniel was written for such a time. It teaches us how to face the greatest challenges with conviction, resolve and faith..
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.description: ALL ACCESs (Hebrews 10:19-22) Easter is a special time to gather with family to celebrate all that God has done to give us new life, hope and purpose. Our Easter experiences feature a welcoming atmosphere, inspiring worship music, and an engaging message from the Bible that applies to your life.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Heart Check
item.description: Heart Check. (1 Samuel 13:13-14) Pastor Xavier Maryland helps us to look within as we perform a Heart Check.
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: Love Lasts Forever
item.description: THE LOVE CHALLENGE. Part 9 – Love Lasts Forever (1 Corinthians 13:6-7) All of us want our lives to matter. We all have talents and abilities and feel we can make a difference for good. Our greatest impact, though, is not necessarily in the big moments of our lives. Rather, it is the everyday choices of how we treat each other and others that says a great deal about who we are and how important our presence in this world can be. In 1 Corinthians 13, God shows us about living life at its highest level. That is it is called, “The Love Chapter.” It teaches us how to let God pull us out of the self-centeredness of our environment and learn how to live life on a higher level. Our series will encourage us in all the ways we are doing life right and show us how to reach upward to an even greater level of fulfillment. Come and take The Love Challenge and see what your life can be!
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Love Is Content
item.description: THE LOVE CHALLENGE. Part 4 – Love Is Content (1 Corinthians 13:1-4) All of us want our lives to matter. We all have talents and abilities and feel we can make a difference for good. Our greatest impact, though, is not necessarily in the big moments of our lives. Rather, it is the everyday choices of how we treat each other and others that says a great deal about who we are and how important our presence in this world can be. In 1 Corinthians 13, God shows us about living life at its highest level. That is it is called, “The Love Chapter.” It teaches us how to let God pull us out of the self-centeredness of our environment and learn how to live life on a higher level. Our series will encourage us in all the ways we are doing life right and show us how to reach upward to an even greater level of fulfillment. Come and take The Love Challenge and see what your life can be!
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Wise Men (And Women) Still Seek Him
item.description: Home for Christmas; Part 3 - Wise Men (And Women) Still Seek Him (Matthew 2:1-11) Unlock the enchantment of the greatest story ever told, as we explore The Unlikely Characters of Christmas in our message series: Home for Christmas. Discover the story behind each of the characters, their encounter with the Messiah, and how their lives were changed forever, leaving a lasting impact on each of the Christmas story reader’s hearts.

Mantel is president and CEO of Living Water International, an international ministry which drills water wells in impoverished communities in third world countries. Living Water International began as a ministry of Sugar Creek and has grown into an amazing worldwide ministry supported by hundreds of churches.

item.title: How To Repair A Damaged Friendship
item.description: FRIENDS: We’re Better Together. Part 6 – How To Repair A Damaged Friendship (Matthew 5:21-27; Matthew 18:15-16) The pandemic has separated people from each other, and it has left a terrible void. There is a sense across the entire country of being disconnected and lonely. All of the studies today are showing that one of the great felt needs is reconnecting with others and making new friends. This series will teach us the wisdom God gives to us in making new relationships and strengthening existing ones.
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: Loving Someone To Christ
item.description: WHO’S YOUR ONE? Part 3 – Loving Someone To Christ (Psalm 126:5-6) We had to spend the last 18 months being inwardly focused. Sugar Creek had to focus on helping those connected to our church get to the other side. But ultimately, inwardly focused churches die. If a church is just all about us and what we want, we will die as a church as all around us those who don’t know our Lord perish. That has never been OK at Sugar Creek. It’s time to return to being who we are again. This series has that in mind. “WHO’S YOUR ONE?”
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Deep Soul Fishing
item.description: WHO’S YOUR ONE? Part 2 – Deep Soul Fishing (Luke 5:1-11) Who in your life right now, that if this was their last day on earth, would be separated from God for all eternity? It’s a simple question but an uncomfortable one. Do we have responsibility in people’s eternal destination? The answer is ‘yes’ and today we will look at a passage of scripture that will explain why this is so important for us to understand.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: Why We Care
item.description: Who's Your One? Part 1 – Why We Care (Matthew 5:13-16) We had to spend the last 18 months being inwardly focused. Sugar Creek had to focus on helping those connected to our church get to the other side. But ultimately, inwardly focused churches die. If a church is just all about us and what we want, we will die as a church as all around us those who don’t know our Lord perish. That has never been OK at Sugar Creek. It’s time to return to being who we are again. This new series has that in mind. “WHO’S YOUR ONE?”
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Life is Worth The Living
item.description: Because He Lives; Part 3 – Life is Worth The Living (1 Kings 19:1-17) Because He Lives is a classic Christian hymn that has been sung countless times and encouraged multitudes for the last 50 years. In the lyrics, we find incredible truths about God that continue to touch our hearts and serve as a reminder of His faithfulness. Explore the way God has provided so that we can face tomorrow, regardless of the situation we might be facing today.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: He Holds The Future
item.description: Because He Lives; Part 2 - He Holds The Future (Acts 27 & 28) Because He Lives is a classic Christian hymn that has been sung countless times and encouraged multitudes for the last 50 years. In the lyrics, we find incredible truths about God that continue to touch our hearts and serve as a reminder of His faithfulness. Explore the way God has provided so that we can face tomorrow, regardless of the situation we might be facing today.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: I Can Face Tomorrow
item.description: Because He Lives; Part 1 – I Can Face Tomorrow (John 11:25) “Because He Lives” is a classic Christian hymn that has been sung countless times and encouraged multitudes for the last 50 years. In the lyrics, we find incredible truths about God that continue to touch our hearts and serve as a reminder of His faithfulness. In part one we will explore the way God has provided so that we can face tomorrow, regardless of the situation we might be facing today. Don’t miss it!
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Our Devotion
item.description: Our Devotion (Acts 2:42-47) Have you ever wondered what it would look like if we just got back to the basics of the first church closest to the time of Jesus? Acts 2 actually gives us a snapshot of the life and ministry of the early church. Although we are thousands of years removed from this moment in church history, and although the early church did not always live up to its own ideals, God calls our church and every church to be devoted to what the first church was committed to. This pandemic that we are coming out of has led many individuals into social isolation and spiritual disconnection. But it’s time to be devoted both to God in our worship and to each other in our love.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Buyers Remorse
item.description: Buyers Remorse (Genesis 25:27-34) Have you ever made a purchase only to immediately regret it? We make decisions just like that in our spiritual lives daily. In this message we’re talking about how God’s word can help us grow in decisions like these.
item.itunes:author: Xavier Maryland

item.title: Identity Theft
item.description: Have you ever experienced identity theft? According to the FTC, this crime is on the rise. An astonishing amount of people has experienced this crime and things have only worsened after the pandemic. One of the hardest things to navigate is when someone has usurped your identity and then having to go through the painful process of proving who you really are. Join us this Sunday as we explore an even greater identity theft that has taken place and its destructive impact on our personal lives, marriages, families and nation, and what God can do to reestablish our true identity.
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: Tale of Two Kingdoms
item.description: There are two kingdoms that we live within. We all choose one of those kingdoms. For some of us it’s the kingdom of self. We choose to reign over our reputation, our relationships, and our comfort. But there is another Kingdom, the Kingdom of God. In this Kingdom we are faced with the call to put our trust in God. One kingdom is offers fear and anxiety, the other kingdom offers hope and peace. Which will you choose?
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: Winning Through Giving
item.description: HOW TO WIN WITHIN. Part 4 – Winning Through Giving (Philippians 4:14-19; Luke 6:38) Life can be a challenge. A race… a journey… a competition… It is filled with struggles, battles, tests and trials of all kinds. But you can endure, overcome and succeed in whatever comes your way. God forgives us when we fail, and promises to meet all of our needs. You can go the distance when you set your eyes on the prize.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: The Secret To Happiness
item.description: HOW TO WIN WITHIN. Part 3 – The Secret To Happiness (Philippians 4:10-13) Life can be a challenge. item.title: Heart Matters
item.description: Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the world. That’s why it’s so important to take care of this vital organ. Spiritually speaking, the same principle is true. Our heart is the most important part of who we are. Nevertheless, so many of us have heart issues that we carry over time that end up taking its toll on our life, our relationships, our work and our future. Is there something we can do to change that? In this message, we will explore a story in the Bible that will help us understand the practical steps we can take to deal with our heart issues. You won’t want to miss it.
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: The Return of the King
item.description: The Beginning of the End. Part 7 - The Return of the King (Revelation 19:11-16; 20) We are all interested in knowing what will happen leading up to the return of Christ. We are going through such extreme and confusing times. How do they fit into what Jesus said would happen in the world when He returns? Toward the end, will things get better or worse? In this series we will explore many of the things revealed for us in the Book of Revelation but also in other parts of the New Testament. We will looking at how we can apply God’s message to our lives.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

Pastor Libin shares how God promises to do the immeasurably more in and through us by the power of His Spirit.

item.description: Becoming a Better Me. Part 1 – God’s Part & My Part In Changing Me (Philippians 2:12-13) God has a mysterious plan for us. To grow and mature us. He is at work in all of our lives. Discover your role in this transformation.

item.description: The Attitude Factor: Part 7 – The Greatest Story Ever Told (Philippians 2:5-11) 2021 is going to be a year to get our attitudes right. 2020 is behind us and we are looking ahead to what God has to offer. Invite family and friends to join you in person or online and don’t miss this series! It’s a message we all need to hear.

item.description: The Attitude Factor: Part 1 – Attitude Doesn’t Depend Upon Circumstances (Philippians 1:1-2; Acts 16:640)2021 is going to be a year to get our attitudes right. 2020 is behind us and we are looking ahead to what God has to offer.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Unshakable Peace
item.description: Pastor Libin Abraham reminds us while we may have trouble and worries, God's peace will overcome.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: The Family
item.description: Most of us have siblings, brothers and sisters, that have had influence in our lives, both good and bad. God has a purpose for siblings and it’s one that we need to be reminded of regularly. Today we will examine the spiritual brother and sister relationships in the church through the lens of Moses’ siblings, Aaron and Miriam.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: The Angels Remind Us of Who Jesus Is
item.description: The Nativity. Part 3 – The Angels Remind Us of Who Jesus Is (Luke 2:8-14) This message is our third most important character of The Nativity, the Angel. At every step of the birth and life of Jesus, there was an angel. What do we learn about these heavenly beings?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Choosing Character Like Joseph
item.description: The Nativity. Part 2 – Choosing Character Like Joseph. As we prepare our hearts for Christmas we concentrate on the four most important characters of the nativity. Last week was about overcoming fear as illustrated through the life of Mary. This message is on what we learn about living life through the example of Joseph.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Learning to Trust Like Mary
item.description: The Nativity. Part 1 – Learning to Trust Like Mary. Join us each Sunday in December as we celebrate the birth of Jesus. Pastor Mark Hartman shares the story of the nativity, focussing on a different member of that Holy night each week.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Shalom
item.description: Shalom. The presence of the Gospel is the restoration of God’s design for a people and community – and it is marked by the presence of harmonious relationship and beauty – the presence of SHALOM.
item.itunes:author: Don Waybright

item.title: Operation Rescue
item.description: Rising Above Hard Times. Part 5 – Operation Rescue (James 5:19-20) We all know someone in our lives who, for whatever reason, has fallen to the side. How do we help? What steps do we take? Will you be seeing that person during the Thanksgiving holiday? We will offer some practical help in loving someone else back to God.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How Prayer Changes Things
item.description: Rising Above Hard Times. Part 4 – How Prayer Changes Things (James 5:13-18) Prayer helps to align us with God’s will and purpose. It activates the power of God. It is intended to be the language that gets through to God. This Sunday Pastor Mark will take us through what James was the earthly brother of Jesus. After he had come to faith in Christ, he was lovingly known as, “Camel knees” because he spent so much time on his knees in prayer. He found the power of God through spending time with God in prayer. If there is anyone who can teach us about how to connect with God, it is “camel knees” himself. Let James teach us how to change things in our life through prayer.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What The Bible Teaches About Supernatural Healing
item.description: Rising Above Hard Times. Part 3 – What The Bible Teaches About Supernatural Healing (James 5:14-16) Sickness strikes all of our lives from time to time. God doesn’t promise to supernaturally heal us every time. We thank the Lord for doctors, medicines and good common sense when it comes to our bodies. God also does still supernaturally heal. Let's see what the Bible say about that.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What To Do When The Bad Won’t Stop
item.description: Rising Above Hard Times. Part 2 – What To Do When The Bad Won’t Stop. (James 5:7-12) All of us go through hard times but what happens when the hard times are relentless? What do we do when a hurtful situation just refuses to get better? Pastor Mark talks through what God says to do. You can actually rise above this moment instead of being carried away by its current.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Justice Is Required
item.description: Rising Above Hard Times. Part 1 – Justice Is Required (James 5:1-6) James 5:1-6 weaves together two topics: Money & Justice. James shows us how important it is to money in our lives the way God intended. To not do so can actually cause the usage of our money to be a source of injustice towards others.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Revive Our Nation
item.description: Revive Us Again. Part 3 - Revive Our Nation. All of us love our country and are so grateful for America. We know the goodness of this country and how God has used and blessed it through the centuries. But today America needs Christ followers more than at any other time to pray and seek God’s Face and lead in a returning to God.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Revive Our Church
item.description: Revive Us Again. Part 2 – Revive Our Church (Revelation 2:3,4) Over the last four decades, God has blessed and worked through our church to impact the world. But often we have to come back to the very core of who we are, our First Love. It is time now to renew our commitment of love to God and to his body. We are the strongest when we are fully devoted to Christ and united with each other.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Revive Me
item.description: Revive Us Again. Part 1 – Revive Me (Psalm 85:6) While we long for a move of God in our nation and in our church, we must realize that God’s greatest move has to begin in each of us first. Now is the time to search honestly and surrender fully our own hearts to the Lord. This has always been the birthing place of a mighty move of God – a personal brokenness and longing for God.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: We Need To Support
item.description: DARING TO START AGAIN. Part 3 – We Need To Support. Sugar Creek is a church that has its priorities straight. We are deeply committed to the Great Commission of reaching the world and discipling those we reach. We are touching lives all over this region and around the world. To continue doing so will take all of us to be a part of the mission.”
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: We Need To Serve Again
item.description: DARING TO START AGAIN. Part 2 – We Need To Serve Again. The church has never been about just showing up and neither has the Christian life. Part of spiritual growth and maturity is allowing the Lord to use your talents, abilities, and spiritual gifts to bless other people. We have taken a break from serving while we have been working through the pandemic. The pandemic is not over but We Need To Serve Again.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: We Need Each Other
item.description: DARING TO START AGAIN. Part 1 – We Need Each Other. We must be careful with the COVID virus, especially those who are at higher risks. But what we cannot do is hunker down forever. There is a time to start again. Pastor Mark will be back this Sunday, September 13 to begin that conversation in his first message entitled, We Need Each Other. Now is the right time to Dare To Start Again.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Focus On The Promises
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 6 – Focus On The Promises. God has given us promises. Today we must claim them by faith but one day, we will declare by sight because God will bring them to pass. You won’t have to wait until heaven to see the rescue of God. You will see His Hand and His Strength in your life here on earth as you claim His promises. You will witness God deliver you time after time and fulfill His promises in your life. You will see it throughout this coronavirus and beyond. Pastor Mark teaches how to recognize our problems but focus on God’s promises. Psalm 68:1 tells us to let God arise and His enemies be scattered.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Don’t Forget To Live Today
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 5 – Don’t Forget To Live Today. Too many people live for tomorrow but forget to live today. Don’t let today pass you by while you wait for better days. This is the day the Lord has made with you in mind. Pastor Mark will take us through the words of Jesus that show us how to live in this moment to its fullest.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Attitude That Gives Us Altitude
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 4 – Attitude That Gives Us Altitude (Acts 16:6 40) All of us know that our attitude is one of the most important aspects of life. In many ways, our attitude makes or breaks who we really are. But how can you have a Godly attitude when everything seems to be against you? Pastor Mark’s message will take us to a bizarre story from the book of Acts that teaches us that the power of a faith-based attitude can turn even the hardest of times.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Choose Wait, Not Worry
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 3 – Choose Wait, Not Worry (Philippians 4:6-8) Waiting on God and Worrying about problems takes the same amount of energy but one creates peace and the other pain. It is all about what we focus on. Worry puts its focus on something that seems out of control. But waiting on God puts its focus on the God who is in control. How people get past their worrying? It isn’t a change in conditions…it’s something else. Pastor Mark helps us to overcome our worries.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Choose Faith Not Fear
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 2 – Choose Faith Not Fear (2 Timothy 1:7) We are living in one of the most catastrophic times in modern history. It is a great opportunity to be a Christian. The Bible teaches us that there is hope at the end of our rope. Our responses provide the opportunity to show those around us how the Lord comes through for us during the worst of times.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: See Your Problems In A New Way
item.description: Hope at the End of Your Rope; Part 1 – See Your Problems In A New Way. The stress levels we are experiencing these days is absolutely amazing. We live in Houston, one of the largest hot spots for the COVID virus in the entire country. Putting on a mask everywhere we go and being careful about everything wears on all of us. Will your children attend school in person or at home? If they are at home, how do you pull that off again? You may ask yourself, ” Will I have a job a month from now? 6 months from now? If I don’t, how will I make it financially? In this environment, how will I ever find another job?” There is a feeling of being, “at the end of our rope.” You need to know that there is Hope At The End of Your Rope.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Successful Life Redirection
item.description: Life Interrupted. Part 4 – Successful Life Redirection (1 Peter 5:5b-7) You probably can remember a time when you made your plans and formed your dreams, only to see everything fall apart because of some situation. Those unexpected interruptions we all go through hurt so much. The global pandemic is a clear example of that. But, how would your life change if there was a way for the next interruption to be a successful redirection to something better? Moreover, what if there was a way to help you see it as God’s intervention redirecting you towards an unexpected purpose? Join us as we conclude our series “Life Interrupted” by learning the key to a successful life redirection.
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: Redirection
item.description: Life Interrupted. Part 3 – Redirection (2 Timothy 1:7, 1 John 3:3-4, Colossians 1:29) Why do you attend or watch church each week? What drives you to gather in worship with others and do what we call “going to Church”? We believe it’s because Jesus designed His church to motivate and encourage us to accomplish the things that move us to a deeper place in our lives. He’s working in your life in a way you don’t expect! When things go wrong or take an unexpected turn… He is there guiding us. In every worship service, connect group, serve opportunity, and beyond. He gave us the church, the community, the support to set us down the path He intended for each of us. That’s what we’ll be talking about this Sunday, a Life Interrupted. Join us online, as we talk about how to recognize the interruptions in our lives and see them as God’s intervention instead. In the midst of these crazy days let’s redirect our perceptions to find His purpose for our lives.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: A Better Normal
item.description: Life Interrupted. Part 2 – A Better Normal. If there’s one thing that’s uniting the world together right now it is simply that all of our lives in some way have been interrupted. Our plans have changed, our trips have canceled, and the normal rhythms of life have been altered. Or maybe this season has brought to you far more serious interruptions than that. So how are you dealing with your life’s interruptions? Or rather, what are you doing with your life’s interruptions? In this season of uncertainty and interruption, we are reaching back to a place of normalcy. We have all said this at some point in the last few weeks, “I can’t wait for things to be normal again.” There’s a part of us that just wants to get back to what is familiar and comfortable. But what if instead of reaching back at an old normal, God is wanting us to reach forward to a new one? What if this whole season is to lead us to a place that is better than normal? Join us as we unpack what better than normal can look like and how we get there.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Embracing Interruptions
item.description: Life Interrupted. Part 1 - Embracing Interruptions. If there’s one thing that’s uniting the world together right now it is simply that all of our lives in some way have been interrupted. Our plans have changed, our trips have canceled, and the normal rhythms of life have been altered. Or maybe this season has brought to you far more serious interruptions than that. So how are you dealing with your life’s interruptions? Or rather, what are you doing with your life’s interruptions? This weekend we will talk about how we can actually embrace the interruptions of our life rather than trying to escape them. Because I believe with all my heart that God has tucked into these interruptions purpose, meaning and maybe even reasons for joy.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Out of Many, One
item.description: Out of Many, One "E pluribus unum" means "Out of Many, One" in Latin. It stands for UNITY. We celebrate those of you who have been united to serve this country during these recent difficult times.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Getting My Priorities Straight
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 8 – Getting My Priorities Straight (James 4:13-17) Priorities can help us make the most of our life. They keep us from wasting time and ensure that our life will make the greatest impact. Learning how to get our priorities straight is one of the greatest things to discover.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Should You Be The Judge
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 7 – Should You Be The Judge? (James 4:11-12) Judging isn’t always wrong. When is it OK to judge and when is it not? That is what we’re talking about as we continue through the practical and penetrating book of James.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: The Unstoppable Church
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 6 – How To Stop An Argument (James 4:1-10) Learning why arguments start is one way to avoid them. Learning how to positively deal with conflict is something that would change ever relationship of your life. You could really help yourself by hearing what God says about this.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: The Unstoppable Church
item.description: The Unstoppable Church (Acts 1:8-2:12) Note: This was the first Sunday to return to in-person church, after the stay-at-home order for Covid-19. On Pentecost Sunday, the Spirit of God descended upon 120 believers who had been praying for His Power to fall! Wow, did it ever! On that day a movement of life began as the Church of Jesus Christ was born. Now, 2,000 years later our church is reopening its doors after two months of online only gathering amidst the worst pandemic of the past 100 years, to continue to carry out our mission. Today Sugar Creek online and those in our physical campuses join hands in celebration of our God and look forward to a time of renewal.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Part 5 – Shut My Mouth!
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 5 – Shut My Mouth! (James 3:1-12) How many times have you said that to yourself just a few seconds too late? Is it even possible to tame your tongue? The Bible says it is. So how?
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: Making Right Decisions
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 4 – Making Right Decisions (James 3:13-18) Making right decisions is by far the most difficult thing we ever learn to do. We count on experience to teach us how to improve our decision making. But, James 3:13-18 reminds us that sometimes experience teaches us the wrong things, instead of the best. Right decisions are made when we apply the Truth of the Bible to our decision making. Pastor Mark will be helping us to see how to do that.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Mothers Who Move the Heart of God
item.description: Mothers Who Move the Heart of God (John 2:1-12) Life has so many expectations of who we are to be as individuals and even who we are to be as moms. But what do you do when life doesn’t go as planned and what you need has ran out? On this Mother’s Day, we will be looking at a particular crisis and the response of a mom that moved the heart of God.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Real Christianity Does More Than Talk
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 3 – Real Christianity Does More Than Talk. Is your Christianity real or just cultural? Is it life changing or have you just learned the right words to say? There is an alive faith that can get you to heaven and keep your growing deep and closer to God. What is the evidence for a real relationship with God?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Are You Prejudice?
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 2 – Are You Prejudice? (James 2:1-13) We hear a lot about the subject of prejudice these days, don’t we? Usually, the word relates to ethnicity but there are other ways to express a judgmental spirit. The Book of James takes this subject on says it is not an expression of Authentic Christianity.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Real or Fake?
item.description: Authentic Christianity. Part 1 – Real or Fake? (James 1:26-27) The world doesn’t have an absence of religion. It just has too little of the real heart of God. What really matters to God? The answer might surprise you.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What Does the Resurrection Prove?
item.description: EASTER: What Does the Resurrection Prove?? (Ephesians 1:20)
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: When Jesus Came to Town
item.description: When Jesus Came to Town (Matthew 21:1-11) Lead Pastor Mark Hartman talks on the arrival of Jesus into Jerusalem on Palm Sunday using the acronym PALM..
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Which News Are You Listening To?
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 7 – Which News Are You Listening To? (James 1:21-25) Our Bible is big and sometimes hard to grasp. Your Bible will breathe life into your story if you learn how to make the most of it. This message helps us all learn how to get more from our Bible. This could be a life changer.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Mad About You!
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 6 – Mad About You! (James 1:19-20) Is your family getting a little bit of cabin fever? How’s the temperature at your home? Everyone gets angry from time to time, but not all anger is negative. It can go wrong when we are not in control of it. In this message we will dig deep into what causes our anger to cross the line and how to take back control.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Attitude is Everything
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 5 – Attitude is Everything (James 1:16-18) You have heard this statement, “Attitude is everything,” all your life. Probably because it’s true. Jesus said that the ‘truth will set you free.” Attitude is all about being set free from hurtful surroundings, realizing what is true about God’’s Word and His control in our lives. We all need a healthy dose of “attitude correction” from time to time.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Letting My Money Change Me For Good
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 4 – Letting My Money Change Me For Good (James 1:9-11) God uses money; both the lack of it and its surplus to improve our lives. Learning how to manage both extremes will challenge our character and allow us to deepen our walk with God. Come explore what God is doing with you through your money.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How To Overcome Your Tempting Times
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 3 – How To Overcome Your Tempting Times (James 1:12-16) We all struggle with tempting moments every day. What is Satan’s strategy and how do we rise above tempting times? You can win more often if you better understand what is going on. That is the goal of this message's verses in James.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How To Make Better Decisions
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 2 – How To Make Better Decisions(James 1:5-8) The greatest challenge of life is making decisions. Some contend we are just a collection of the decisions we make. The greater our wisdom the higher we soar. So, gaining wisdom is the most important thing we can do. Learn what the Bible says about making better decisions.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How To React When Life Hurts
item.description: Thriving In A Hostile World; Part 1 – How To React When Life Hurts (James 1:1-4) Life can hurt. Many things we encounter are not all that fun but they are all a part of God’s plan to mature us. Problems not only reveal our character, they grow it. Problems can even grow our joy.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Love and Respect
item.description: After the Honeymoon. Part 4 – Love and Respect (Ephesians 5:33) It is evident that God created men and women different from one another. By God’s design, men and women are wired uniquely both emotionally and physically. These differences can be met with understanding or they can be met with conflict. Fortunately, God has identified for us the parameters by which our differences can actually bring us closer not further. And when these parameters are applied, couples experience far better communication, understanding and appreciation for one another. Join us for this last segment as we unpack the two keys that are critical to a lasting, more fulfilling marriage.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Why Marriages Fall Apart
item.description: After the Honeymoon. Part 3 – Why Marriages Fall Apart (Selected Scriptures) Often as couples enter marriage, they are enveloped by emotions and ideals. And when there is a gap between expectation and reality, marriages tend to struggle and even fall apart. However, each marriage goes through seasons and stages. Knowing what they are and how to best respond to them is the key to staying together and fighting for each other. Discover the most common stages of marriage and how each couple can overcome and thrive through every one of them.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Marriage Myths
item.description: After the Honeymoon. Part 2 – Marriage Myths (Ephesians 5:18-32) In our culture today, we are inundated with messages about what marriage is and isn’t. From Hollywood to novels, from friends to family, and strangers to coworkers, everyone seems to have an opinion. But God, the designer of marriage, gives us clear truths in His Word that defines marriage in ways perhaps contrary to culture or popular opinions.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: How God Designed Marriage
item.description: After the Honeymoon. Part 1 – How God Designed Marriage (Genesis 2:18-25) If you have ever assembled furniture or a piece of equipment, you’ve quickly realized that it’s always better when you actually follow the designer’s manual. This week, we will look at the origin of marriage and God’s design for it. From the first marriage to every marriage since then, God has a plan and a wonderful design for marriage that will produce abiding joy and genuine intimacy. Join us as we take a look at God’s masterful design for marriage.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Forget Not All His Benefits
item.description: How to Build Better Relationships. Just as God wants us to have a great relationship with Him, we must also find and develop the right types of friendships.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Forget Not All His Benefits
item.description: Forget Not All His Benefits (Psalm 103:2) with Bruce Ammons, Pastor of Guest Ministries
item.itunes:author: Bruce Ammons

item.title: Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace
item.description: After Christmas (Matthew 2:1-12) It is still the season of Christ’ birth and today we will look at the story of the wise men and their journey to see the newborn Jesus. This passage of scripture will give us insight into what following Jesus looks like after Christmas.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace
item.description: AND HE SHALL BE CALLED… Part 3 – Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace (Isaiah 9:6)
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Son of God, Wonderful Counselor
item.description: AND HE SHALL BE CALLED… Part 2 – Son of God, Wonderful Counselor (Isaiah 9:6)
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: The Promised Messiah
item.description: AND HE SHALL BE CALLED… Part 1: The Promised Messiah; Isaiah 9:1-5
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Yes! Jesus Is Worth It!
item.description: A seed must be planted and die in order to produce a new harvest. This weekend we tell the story of ordinary Sugar Creek members who left their comfort zone and pushed the limits to plant the seed of life in people around the world. They are witnesses to the extraordinary harvest of new lives! Join us as we examine what Jesus will do when His people answer YES! Jesus is Worth It!
item.itunes:author: Don Waybright

item.title: Freedom to Brag
item.description: Galatians: How To Live In Freedom, Part 12 – Freedom to Brag (Galatians 6:14) The greatest battle for freedom that has been fought and won was not between nations, tribes, or people. It was the battle for the freedom of our souls, won by Jesus Christ. Still many still live each day with a feeling of defeat. Don’t let that be the case in your life! In this series, we will discover through the book of Galatians how to live in, enjoy and spread the freedom that Christ alone brings. Don’t miss one message of this series!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Let's Be There For Each Other
item.description: Galatians: How To Live In Freedom, Part 11 - Let's Be There For Each Other (Galatians 6:1-10) The greatest battle for freedom that has been fought and won was not between nations, tribes, or people. It was the battle for the freedom of our souls, won by Jesus Christ. Still many still live each day with a feeling of defeat. Don’t let that be the case in your life! In this series, we will discover through the book of Galatians how to live in, enjoy and spread the freedom that Christ alone brings. Don’t miss one message of this series!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Is Jesus Worth It?
item.description: Is Jesus Worth It? Nik Ripken, and his wife Ruth have served on the front lines of ministry in the most hostile places in the world for the past 35 years. From tribal areas of Somalia to the gulags of Russia, to the persecuted house churches of China, and the warzones of Afghanistan, Nik and Ruth have journeyed faithfully in pursuit of answering the question, Is Jesus Worth It?
item.itunes:author: Nikk Ripiken

item.title: You Can Be Like Jesus
item.description: Galatians: How To Live In Freedom. Part 10 – You Can Be Like Jesus (Galatians 5:16-26) The greatest battle for freedom that has been fought and won was not between nations, tribes, or people. It was the battle for the freedom of our souls, won by Jesus Christ. Still many still live each day with a feeling of defeat. Don’t let that be the case in your life!
