item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Seeing Your Job (School) As Your Mission
item.description: MAKE YOUR LIFE COUNT, Part 4 – Seeing Your Job (School) As Your Mission. Why has God put you on this earth? What is He wanting you to accomplish and to be? That is what Pastor Mark will teach this Sunday as we conclude our series, Make Your Life Count.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Seeing My Resources With New Eyes
item.description: MAKE YOUR LIFE COUNT, Part 3 – Seeing My Resources With New Eyes (1 Timothy 6) Why has God put you on this earth? What is He wanting you to accomplish and to be? That is what Pastor Mark will teach this weekend as we continue our series, Make Your Life Count!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Embrace God’s Purpose For Your Life
item.description: MAKE YOUR LIFE COUNT, Part 2 – Why Being Involved In The Church Makes You A Better Person (Various Scriptures) The church was Jesus’ idea. He created it to help us grow and deepen our relationship with God and each other. When we are actively involved it helps us to become better people.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Embrace God’s Purpose For Your Life
item.description: MAKE YOUR LIFE COUNT, Part 1 – Embrace God’s Purpose For Your Life (Various Scriptures) Why has God put you on this earth? What is He wanting you to accomplish and to be? That is what Pastor Mark will teach this weekend as we begin a new series, Make Your Life Count!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Friend of Sinners
item.description: Friend of Sinners (Luke 15:1-31) Jesus was criticized for being the friend of sinners. We have hope today because Jesus did not avoid sinners and treat them as undesirable. He purposely sought them out to offer the kingdom of God and a new life. He came to seek and save the lost. We are excited to welcome Pastor Fenton Moorhead back to Sugar Creek! Pastor Fenton Moorhead and his wife Mary have served in various ministry roles for 56 years in 6 states including Senior Pastor of Sugar Creek Baptist Church from 1989-2001.
item.itunes:author: Fenton Moorhead

item.title: Standing Strong in Everyday Life
item.description: We all know how easy it is to cave into the pressures around us and to the voices around us and not stand up for what it is we claim to believe. When we see conviction in action we stand in awe. Throughout history people of conviction have left their mark. Living in conviction has a way of moving us toward something greater. We look at a character in the Bible who teaches us how to have this kind of conviction and how we can stand strong in that conviction.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: Knowing is Becoming
item.description: Oftentimes we equate knowing God to simply a mental ascent or an understanding of who he is. However in the scriptures, knowing Christ means that we become like Christ. It’s more transformational than it is informational. What does becoming like Christ look like? Is it even possible?
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: God’s Pursuit of The Runaway
item.description: God’s Pursuit of The Runaway (Genesis 28:10-22) It’s not unusual to find ourselves running from God, or even from people sometimes. Maybe we are running out of guilt, fear, self-reliance and many other reasons. Usually, in our run from God or others, we find ourselves isolated and in the dark. But the good news is that we are not alone! Pursuing us is a power greater and more faithful and good than we could ever imagine. Join us as we learn of God’s merciful pursuit for us.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: What Citizenship is All About
item.description: GOD & COUNTRY DAY - What Citizenship is All About. This weekend is God and Country Day! Government is actually God’s idea. He created countries and governments and has told us how to be the best citizens possible. We are grateful to live in such a wonderful country. We will combine God’s Word with the privileges democracy gives us, along with pointers for how to be a great citizen.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: My Part and God’s Part In Changing Me
item.description: Keeping Up Your Guard. Part 4 - My Part and God’s Part In Changing Me (Jude 20-25) The greatest thing that could ever happen to us is that every day we are becoming more and more like Jesus. Sometimes, it certainly doesn’t feel like it and other times we are seeing such great progress in our spiritual growth. What part of that whole change is my responsibility and how do I do it? What part of that change is God’s responsibility and how does He do it? The last part of the Book of Jude explains it to us.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Living With The End In Mind
item.description: Keeping Up Your Guard. Part 3 – Living With The End In Mind (Jude 14-19) What happens after we die? One of the things the Bible talks about is the judgment for those who know Jesus and a different judgment for those who do not. The judgment of both has a different purpose and criteria in mind.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What To Guard Against
item.description: Keeping Up Your Guard. Part 2 – What To Guard Against (Jude 1:3b-13) The Book of Jude is one of the smallest books of the New Testament, containing only 25 verses. Yet, it is an amazingly powerful book! Jude teaches us to contend for our faith and be on the lookout both inside and outside the church for those who would lead us down the wrong path. We face the erosion of moral truth of scripture within our culture today, but we also need to be on the watch for things inside the church that can compromise The Faith. Learning how to keep up our guard is what the Book of Jude is all about.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Our Amazing Salvation
item.description: Keeping Up Your Guard. Part 1 – Our Amazing Salvation (Jude 1-3a) We begin a new series going through the New Testament book of Jude. Maybe you have never heard a message from the book of Jude. It wouldn’t be surprising. It is a tiny one chapter book seemingly hidden toward the end of the New Testament. Though tiny, it packs a punch.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Unstuck
item.description: Unstuck (1 Corinthians 13:4-7) Sometimes we find ourselves stuck, and we get in a rut. We desire for our life and relationships to be different. Maybe we are even stuck spiritually. Tim Homa talks about how we can become Unstuck in our relationships with one another and with God.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: A Renewed Vision of Who We Are
item.description: A Renewed Vision of Who We Are. Pastor Mark shares with our church a renewed vision of who we are as Sugar Creek using Isaiah 41:14-20. It is a great time to hear from the Lord how He is wanting to use us as a church.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: You are Making a Great Impact as a Mother
item.description: You are Making a Great Impact as a Mother (Exodus 1 & 2) May 12 was Mother’s Day. Pastor Mark uses of one of the greatest mothers in the Bible to teach our mothers (and dads) how to allow God to use you to make a powerful impact in your children’s eternity.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: 9-1-1 Prayers
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 6: 9-1-1 Prayers (Daniel 2:12-28) We all face emergencies. It is just a fact of life. The problem is that when they come, they have the potential to destroy our lives, and even our faith in God. But, what if there was a way for emergencies to strengthen our faith instead of shattering it?
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: Praying Kingdom Prayers
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 5: Praying Kingdom Prayers (Habakkuk 3:2) Oftentimes, our prayers as great as they might be, become all about us. If God were to answer your prayers, would anyone’s life really change except yours? The Bible invites Christ-followers to pray big, audacious, God-sized prayers. Learn how to pray Kingdom prayers that catalyze change not only in our life, but in our world.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Which Thief Are You?
item.description: Easter 2019: Which Thief Are You? (Luke 23:33-42) We gather to celebrate the resurrection of Jesus Christ. There would have never been a resurrection without first the death of Jesus on the Cross. So, as we are considering His resurrection, Pastor Mark will take us back for a few moments to the crucifixion of Christ and challenge us with a question, “Which Thief Are You?”.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Why Should God Answer My Prayer?
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 4: Why Should God Answer My Prayer? (Luke 18:9-14) Have you ever wondered why a great and powerful God who made everything and is in charge of the universe should answer our prayers? We are pretty impressed when someone of notable influence and power replies to our email or gives us a call back. God doesn’t answer our prayers because we earned it or because he owes us something. So then why does He? Watch and find out!
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham

item.title: Getting Results In Your Prayer
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 3 – Getting Results In Your Prayer. (Psalm 37:4-5) We are on an amazing journey of 40 Days of Prayer. We decided as a church to pause and pray together. We are asking God for His intervention in our lives individually, as a family and as a church. This Sunday we are looking at how we can get greater results in our prayers. Psalm 37:4 tells us that God will give us the desires of our heart. What does that mean and how can it actually become a reality in our lives? Come and take this journey with our spiritual family at Sugar Creek.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Obstacles to Prayer
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 2 – Obstacles to Prayer; Prayer is our lifeline to God. It’s the direct link to our heavenly Father. He loves to hear from us and longs to have those intimate conversations. Yet, for some of us, obstacles get in the way of this precious connection with the Almighty. These obstacles can lead to a stagnant prayer life or even worse no prayer at all. Let's hear about ways to clear obstacles that have a negative impact on our prayer life.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: When The Church Prays Together
item.description: 40 Days of Prayer. Part 1 – When The Church Prays Together. As a whole church, we are praying for revival. We are praying for a breakout of the power of God among us. What change would happen to you? To your family? To our church? To our region? This message begins our 40 Days of Prayer.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How Not To Fight In The Church
item.description: New Testament Postcards. Part 3 – How Not To Fight In The Church (3 John) Have you ever been a part of a church that was fighting? It is devastating and embarrassing, wasn’t it? Aren’t you so glad we have such peace at Sugar Creek? Using what happened in 3rd John, the Holy Spirit will show us, How Not To Fight In Church.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Truth and Love
item.description: New Testament Postcards: Part 2 – Truth and Love (2nd John) What ties us together at Sugar Creek? What helps us to know how to respond to the deep social issues of our day?Pastor Mark Hartman teaches on the book of 2nd John entitled “Truth and Love.” It is the next tiny book of the New Testament Postcard series almost no one ever teaches on yet is filled with such wisdom!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Getting a Wrong Right
item.description: New Testament Postcards: Part 1 – Getting a Wrong Right (Philemon) There are some one-chapter books of the New Testament which are rarely taught. Pastor Mark is addressing three of those books in a series entitled, New Testament Postcards. The Book of Philemon is the story of a slave who ran away from his Christian master. As a runaway, that slave encountered the Apostle Paul in Rome and came to faith in Christ. It is an amazing story of freedom, the power of God to restore relationships and to change lives.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How to Experience Abundant Life
item.description: How to Experience Abundant Life. (John 10:10) Jesus really wants you to experience abundant life! Today’s message with Bruce Ammons helps us discover how taking just one action can help to reduce stress, give you a better sense of purpose and overcome self-sabotage. Invite a friend, this is a message you will not want to miss!)
item.itunes:author: Bruce Ammons

item.title: What Happens After I Die
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 6 – What Happens After I Die? (Ecclesiastes 7, 9) Our series SEARCH: Answering Life’s Biggest Questions has helped us to be more centered in the way we think about life, ourselves and others. We are learning how to get more and produce more with our life. We know that one day our bodies will die. How do we better prepare for that day and for What Happens After We Die? That is the focus of God’s Word for us in this message.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What Should Now Be the Focus of My Life? Others.
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 5 – What Should Now Be the Focus of My Life? Others. (2 of 2) Ecclesiastes 4; Our new series SEARCH: Answering Life’s Biggest Questions has really helped us to begin this new year with a greater level of intentionality. We have begun answering the question, What Should Be the Focus Of Our Lives? We will continue to answer this question with the second great priority God has told us to build within our everyday lives.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What Should Now Be the Focus of My Life? God.
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 4 – What Should Now Be the Focus of My Life? God. (1 of 2) Ecclesiastes 5; Our new series SEARCH: Answering Life’s Biggest Questions has been eye opening. It has helped to begin this new year with more understanding and purpose in our lives. We are becoming more intentional in our living. So, it makes sense that now we ask the question, What Should Be The Focus Of Our Lives? It will take two weeks to address this vital question.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How Can I Make The Most of My Time?
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 3 – How Can I Make The Most of My Time? (Ecclesiastes 3) God doesn’t do anything by accident. He always has a purpose, plan and even a “time” behind everything that happens. So, how can I make the most of my time? How can I make the most of the bad things that happen to me along with the good? The Bible will teach us how live our life in such a way that we make the most of it. It could totally change how you approach your life for the rest of your life.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: How Can I Find Lasting Happiness?
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 2 – How Can I Find Lasting Happiness? (Ecclesiastes 2) Everyone wants to be happy. All of us want a happiness that is deep enough to withstand the storms of life. The Bible calls that kind of lasting happiness, joy. Solomon said in Ecclesiastes, “What does it matter how long I live if I don’t enjoy life while I am living? So, how do we acquire that deep abiding happiness and joy? You really actually can have it! But, it doesn’t come in the ways most people imagine. We are in a series entitled SEARCH: Answering Life’s Biggest Questions going through the Book of Ecclesiastes. This weekend, the Bible will answer the question, How Can I Have Lasting Happiness? I think you might be surprised at the answer because its closer to you than maybe you realized.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: What Is The Point of Life?
item.description: ANSWERING LIFE’S BIGGEST QUESTIONS, Part 1 – What Is The Point of Life? (Ecclesiastes 1: 1-11) Why am I here? What is the meaning of my life? When 250 of the most respected philosophers, scientists and intellectuals were asked these questions, most admitted they were clueless. Solomon asked these same questions in the Book of Ecclesiastes and concluded that if a person doesn’t discover the answers and live them out in their daily life, then nothing else they do with their life actually matters! Join us as wel ask the question: What is the point of life? There is an answer!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman

item.title: Respect. Everyone. Period.
item.description: Respect. Everyone. Period. (Psalm 90:12) How would you most like to be treated by people? If given the opportunity to develop your own ideas of how you would be treated by others are you reciprocating that to others? Following the Golden Rule can be the key to understanding how to treat others with kindness, value and respect.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa

item.title: Your Life is Not a Dress Rehearsal
item.description: Your Life is Not a Dress Rehearsal (Psalm 90:12) Many people at the end of the year look back to lament how fast time goes by and regret the wasted opportunities they let go. They commit to make the following year different, only to feel the same guilt at the end. Is there something we can do to change that, not only for 2019, but also for the rest of our lives? Join us as we look at a powerful biblical principle that has the potential to change the way we look at our lives and the way we use it.
item.itunes:author: Juan Carlos Heredia

item.title: God Is Offering You An Indescribable Gift
item.description: It’s A Wonderful Life – Part 3 – God Is Offering You An Indescribable Gift (2 Corinthians 9:15) Come and honor your Savior with worship and the Word, and celebrate the birth of our Lord together as the Family of Sugar Creek Baptist Church.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Your Life Matters More Than You Think
item.description: It’s A Wonderful Life – Because He Came; Part 2 – Your Life Matters More Than You Think (Luke 2:25-38) Individually, many of us wonder from time to time if our life has really made a difference…if we matter. The truth is oftentimes we make an impact in the hearts and lives of others without really realizing it.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Even When Your Situation Seems Hopeless
item.description: It’s A Wonderful Life – Because He Came; Part 1 – Even When Your Situation Seems Hopeless (Galatians 4:3-7) What should you do when all your hope is gone? We have all been in life-crushing moments that leave us feeling that there is no way out; maybe you are there right now. The good news is that there is an answer. Join us in this first part of this Christmas series as Pastor Mark shows how the coming of Jesus can restore our hope even in our greatest times of despair.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Spirit Walk
item.description: Spirit Walk (Galatians 5:25) Experiencing a draught in your life, a barren wilderness where you no longer want to be? Walk the ancient path that leads to the Promised Land…See what a church looks like when it walks this path. The Spirit Walk.
item.itunes:author: Don Waybright

item.title: Our Authority in Christ
item.description: LA GUERRA INVISIBLE: Part 7: Our Authority in Christ (Ephesians 6:13-17) We have been on a journey about spiritual warfare, The Invisible War. We have learned about our enemy who desires to destroy us. But we have also learned about the spiritual weapons of that warfare that have been given to us by our Heavenly Father. With our last message, Our Authority In Christ, we will discover how to live in victory every day of our lives.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Dressed For A War Zone
item.description: LA GUERRA INVISIBLE: Part 6: Dressed For A War Zone (Pt 2/2) (Ephesians 6:13-15) In our series, The Invisible War, we have talked a great deal about our enemy who comes against our lives daily. Last Sunday we began going through the armor God has provided for our protection. This week Pastor Mark identifies the last two defensive pieces of God’s protection for our lives. Come and see that you are much stronger than you ever imagined!
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Dressed For A War Zone
item.description: LA GUERRA INVISIBLE: Part 5: Dressed For A War Zone (Pt 1/2) In our series, The Invisible War, we have talked a great deal about our enemy who comes against our lives daily. How do we survive that attack? God has given us the armor for battle that protects us against everything Satan can throw against us. Pastor Mark begins to identify the protections we have in Christ. Learn how you can put on the whole armor of God and stand against the Satan’s attacks in your life. You are much stronger than you ever imagined!
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: The Dark Side
item.description: THE INVISIBLE WAR: Part 4: The Dark Side (Ephesians 6:12) In our series on spiritual warfare, last week Pastor Mark taught us what the Bible says about the good guys, angels. This weekend’s message is all about the bad guys, demons. Satan has an army whose job is to make life difficult for Christ followers. Who are they and what are their goals?? Don’t miss this Sunday as Pastor Mark teaches about The Dark Side.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Angels – God’s Secret Agents
item.description: THE INVISIBLE WAR: Part 3: Angels – God’s Secret Agents (Ephesians 6:12) Are angels real? If so, what are they like? What are the jobs of these ministering agents? This Sunday Pastor Mark will teach on the subject of Angels – God’s Secret Agents as we continue our series entitled, The Invisible War.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Living In Enemy Territory
item.description: THE INVISIBLE WAR: Part 2 - Living In Enemy Territory (Ephesians 6:10-11) The Bible warns us that we have an enemy who like a roaring lion seeking to destroy us. Ephesians 6:10-11 tells us that Satan has schemes to bring us down. So, what are Satan’s goals and what strategy does he use to damage and destroy?
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Introducing the Enemy
item.description: THE INVISIBLE WAR: Part 1 – Introducing the Enemy (Ezekiel 28:11-19; Isaiah 14:12-17) Life is full of disappointments, wounds and hurts. The Bible tells us there is an enemy, an evil one, who steals and kills and destroys. Paul taught us that our battle is not against flesh and blood but the evil one who is fueling the darkness. Jesus identified this enemy as Satan who is as real as you and me. We are in war! An Invisible war…but a real one, nonetheless. The good news is that “greater is He who is in us than he who is in the world.”. We are reminded in Colossians 2:15 that Jesus triumphed over this evil one through the cross. It’s time we learn about the war and how to live in the victory won for us.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: For Those Not Yet Here
item.description: REACH BEYOND: Part 3 - For Those Not Yet Here (Psalm 102:18-22) Lead Pastor Mark S. Hartman concludes the REACH Beyond campaign message series reviewing the goals and how Sugar Creek can continue to reach further for Christ.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: How Do I Decide How Much to Give to Reach Beyond?
item.description: REACH BEYOND: Part 2 – How Do I Decide How Much to Give to Reach Beyond? (2 Corinthians 8, 9) Sugar Creek is in the middle of a wonderful time of commitment to our future. As a Great Commission church we are totally dedicated to reaching this region with the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Pastor Mark looks into God’s Word to see how our Lord is leading us to reach beyond our walls, and into our community.
item.itunes:author: Dr. Mark Hartman

item.title: Facing the Giants
item.description: REACH BEYOND: Part 1 – Facing the Giants (Numbers 13:1-3, 25-33) Sugar Creek is in the middle of a wonderful time of commitment to our future. As a Great Commission church we are totally dedicated to reaching this region with the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Pastor Mark looks into God’s Word to see how our Lord is leading us to reach beyond our walls, and into our community.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: What is Next for Sugar Creek?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 6: What is Next for Sugar Creek? Pastor Mark concludes the series: WHO WE ARE: A PEOPLE ON MISSION with answering the question, What Is Next For Sugar Creek? In this series we have gone back to our roots, remembered who we are at Sugar Creek and what God has called us to accomplish. We have seen how God has grown and positioned this church to reach this region. It is amazing! And now, where do we go from here? What’s next for Sugar Creek?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: How Do We Do This Together?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 5: How Do We Do This Together? (John 17: 20-23) We have been on an amazing journey as a church returning to our roots of WHO WE ARE. We are certainly a part of the entire “universal” family of God – all believers of all the ages. We are also a family at Sugar Creek. So, what does it mean that our church is a spiritual family?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: How Do We Participate?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 4: How Do We Participate? (Mark 6:33-44) Every so often every church needs to take some time, go back to its roots and remember who it is. We all need to stop and remember who God has called us to be. In our series we have already answered the questions: Where Do We Start? Why Are We Here? and What Really Matters To Us? Mark continues the quest by answering the question: How Do We Participate? It is a truth that participators will always grow further and deeper than observers…every time. Alone we can make an impact. But together, through God’s Spirit, we can change our world!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: What Really Matters To Us?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 3: What Really Matters To Us? (Acts 2:42-47) When we think of Church, a variety of images and descriptions come to mind. Many great and maybe some not so great. What if the only description of Church you had in mind was how the early church was first described in the book of Acts? What if that was the only reference point for how we lived out our individual lives as well as our corporate life as a church. In our next segment of Who We Are, we are looking back thousands of years to learn from the early church what really mattered to them and what should really matter to us. The values of the early church speak volumes into how we ought to live and how we ought to be church that God has called us to be!
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Why Are We Here?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 2 - Why Are We Here? (Acts 1:8-14) It’s easy for any person or organization to drift. Life is so full of challenges and distractions that it can happen to anyone. Churches are not exempt. Churches who become inwardly focused always drift away. That has never been Sugar Creek. Our church has begun a journey of reconnecting with Who We Are. Pastor Mark takes us back to the foundation of Why We Are Here.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Where Do We Start?
item.description: Who We Are - A People On Mission: Part 1 - Where Do We Start? In Part 1 of this series, Pastor Mark answers the question, Where Do We Start? Who we are actually begins with who God is. This journey together will be a defining moment of our future at Sugar Creek.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: A Better Tomorrow Starts Today
item.description: Boundaries: Part 3 - A Better Tomorrow Starts Today (Proverbs 4:23) Its never too late to set boundaries. Even when your past has been full of Boundary-less chaos, today can bring about a fresh start. Start putting healthy boundaries in place now! Join us this weekend as we look at the steps necessary to build these healthy boundaries.
item.itunes:author: Tim Homa, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: How We Establish Healthy Boundaries
item.description: Boundaries: Part 2 - How We Establish Healthy Boundaries. In part 1, we saw that healthy lives require healthy limits. Any relationship that flourishes, requires proper boundaries. But, why do we struggle so much with them and how do we establish boundaries? In part 2 we will explore the practical part in the process of setting boundaries and what you need to do in order to incorporate them in your life.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Boundaries: Why We Need Them
item.description: Boundaries: Part 1 - Boundaries: Why We Need Them (Galatians 6:1-5) We often assume that boundaries are great for others, but not for us. However, a life without boundaries can result in severe dangers like avoidance, compliance, or being overly controlling. The truth is that even though boundaries can sometimes seem unnecessary, they are absolutely critical to a healthy life. Join us this weekend as we kick off a brand new series that will help you define and protect healthy boundaries in your life.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Guest Speaker Quart Graves
item.description: Member Quart Graves shares how God has been faithful, even through difficult times.
item.itunes:author: Quart Graves

item.title: The Secret of America's Strength
item.description: THE SECRET OF AMERICA’S STRENGTH (Proverbs 22:28) July 1st this year is God and Country Day. This annual event is an opportunity for our church family to celebrate the blessing of living in America… the land of the free and the home of the brave. We honor our veterans who perpetuated our freedom through their service and their sacrifice. On this day we worship and pray together, asking God’s Spirit to bring revival to our land, as well hear an inspiring message from Pastor Mark… “The Secret of America’s Strength.”
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: The Power of Sharing Jesus
item.description: POWER LIVING: Part 4 – The Power of Sharing Jesus (Romans 9:1-3) You have an amazing power to rescue your family members and friends through helping them begin a relationship with Jesus Christ. Sharing Jesus with others is actually easier than you might think. This Sunday Pastor Mark concludes our Power Living series with a message showing us how we can be the special connection which results in someone spending eternity in heaven.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: The Power of Pardoning Others
item.description: POWER LIVING: Part 3 -The Power of Pardoning Others (Ephesians 4:32) Life brings times of great stress to relationships and sometimes we find ourselves wounded and maybe bitter. “It just doesn’t make any sense to forgive THAT person.” But, the truth is, our act of forgiveness is not primarily for the other person but for us. There is power is pardoning and Power Mark will guide us through a key verse that can set us free from the morass and pain of resentment.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: The Power of Obeying God
item.description: POWER LIVING: PART 2 – The Power of Obeying God (2 Kings 5:1-14) There are times in which we struggle to understand what God is doing in our lives…and why. We believe by faith that He is at work in our life but sometimes His “way” is very confusing to us. Pastor Mark uses an Old Testament story to unfold three key principles bring such clarity to what is really going on in our life with God. You will walk away with a deeper understanding of what God is doing in you.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

channel.item: The Power of a Balanced Life https:/scbc-sermons.s3.amazonaws.com/2018/20180603-720.m4v Power Living, Part 1 - The Power of a Balanced Life (1 Corinthians 9:24-26) 2 Timothy 1:7 tells us that “God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love and self-control.” We were intended to live powerful lives and one of the aspects of a powerful life is balanced living. In this message, we will explore the value of balance and how to develop it in our lives. Pastor Mark’s message will be so valuable for helping you get and stay on track for a powerful life. Sun, 03 Jun 2018 08:00:00 -0500 > sugar,creek,baptist,church,christian,god,bible,christ,spirit,church,jesus,balance,power power-of-balanced-life Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church no 00:41:55

item.title: Don't Give Up Yet
item.description: Don’t Give Up Yet (Hebrews 11:39-12:3) We all at one point or another go through tough times. They are unavoidable. When we do, we struggle with the sense of wanting to quit. However, what if there was a way that we could endure rather than give up even in the most difficult seasons in our lives? We study a passage with key principles that will help us go forward.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 7: Last Words
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 7: Last Words (2 Thessalonians 3) Over the past two months we have explored what Paul taught about the Second Coming of Christ in the book of 2 Thessalonians. He helped us better understand our coming judgement before God, the coming world leader the Bible calls the antichrist and what will happen when Jesus returns. Let's read Paul’s Last Words in 2 Thessalonians as he teaches us how to live with the end in mind.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 6 - How To Be Ready For Christ’s Return
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 6: How To Be Ready For Christ’s Return (2 Thessalonians 2:13-14) As we have been walking through the book of 2 Thessalonians we have been learning a snapshot of what the Bible teaches about the second coming of Jesus. This Sunday the message will center on How To Be Ready For Jesus’ Return. Pastor Mark will be presenting the gospel in a clear and unstainable way.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 5 - The Battle of Armageddon
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 5: The Battle of Armageddon (2 Thessalonians 2:8b) More than likely you have heard the word Armageddon before. It actually comes from the Bible and describes a last great battle between good and evil, Christ and the antichrist. Lead Pastor Mark Hartman takes us through what the Bible teaches about this event.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 4 - The Splendor of His Coming
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 4: The Splendor of His Coming (2 Thessalonians 2:8; Revelation 19:11-16) The Bible talks about a moment in which Jesus comes back for His followers in an event called the Rapture of the Church. In also talks about a time in which Jesus returns to the earth WITH all of us. The second event is called The Glorious Return of Jesus Christ. Experience the Splendor of His Coming as we continue going through 2 Thessalonians.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 3 - The Antichrist’s Rise to Power
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 3: The Antichrist’s Rise to Power (2 Thessalonians 2:9-12) In Part 2, Sunday Pastor Mark began the explanation of what the Bible teaches about a coming world leader it calls the antichrist. In Part 3, he takes us to the next step of understanding about how this leader emerges, actually performs miracles and deceives many.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 2 - An Introduction to the Antichrist
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 2 - An Introduction to the Antichrist (2 Thessalonians 2:1-8a) In our study through the book of 2 Thessalonians we are learning about what will happen AS THE END COMES. We enter chapter two which speaks about a coming apostasy and the emergence of a man the Bible calls the antichrist. Join us as Pastor Mark helps us understand what the Bible teaches about this amazing time.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 1: Judgment Can Be A Great Thing!
item.description: As The End Comes: 2 Thessalonians. Part 1: Judgment Can Be A Great Thing! (2 Thessalonians 1:1-12) We begin our new series entitled, AS THE END COMES. We are walking through the New Testament book of 2 Thessalonians. It is a miniature book of Revelation and the entire series will highlight what the Bible teaches will happen related to the Second Coming of Jesus. Pastor Mark takes in the entire first chapter which revolves around the Biblical teaching of our coming judgement before God.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Surprised By Hope
item.description: Easter 2018, Surprised By Hope. At Sugar Creek Baptist Church, you'll experience inspiring music, an engaging message from the Bible and a welcoming atmosphere. Discover the life-changing message of Easter and how it can make a difference in your family!
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 7: God’s Promise of Security
item.description: GET A GRIP; Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 7: God’s Promise of Security (Various Scriptures) There is nothing that brings more insecurity to our life than the unknown and nothing more unknown than our future. All through this series we have been trying to let the Bible speak practically about the challenging emotions of our lives. This Sunday we wrap up our series by looking at God’s Promise of Security especially about the unknowns we face ahead.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 6: Freedom From Fear
item.description: GET A GRIP; Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 6: Freedom From Fear (Exodus 3:1-4, 17) Each of us were created to live extraordinary and meaningful lives. God calls us to big audacious goals that we could only achieve with his help. However most of us settle for something far less because we are afraid to say yes to what is right in front of us. This weekend we will look at a conversation between the Almighty God and a fearful, timid man by the name of Moses. We will find here, the real struggle between faith and fear, but also the way forward where we are no longer bound by our fears.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 5: Releasing Regret
item.description: GET A GRIP; Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 5: Releasing Regret (1 Timothy 1:12-17) Most decisions we make in life result in rewards or regrets. While the rewarding elements of life mark us with celebrations and joy, the regretful ones leave us disappointed and at times even paralyzed from moving forward. We look at God’s instructions on how we release the weight of the deepest regrets in life so that we can step into today, and be free from our past.
item.itunes:author: Libin Abraham, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 4: Leaving Loneliness Behind
item.description: Part 4: Leaving Loneliness Behind (2 Timothy 4) Sometimes we can feel lonely because we really are alone and sometimes we can feel lonely even when we are surrounded by others. There are usually some key factors that contribute to pain of feeling all alone. Let's address those factors and what positive steps we can take when loneliness settles in.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 3: Why Worry?
item.description: Part 3: Why Worry? (Matthew 6:25-34) The emotion of worry has no benefit in our lives and actually can be destructive if left unchecked. In this message, we look at the dangers of worry and discover practical steps in living a worry free life.
item.itunes:author: Richy Fisher, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 2: Living Through The Battle of the Blues
item.description: GET A GRIP; Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 2: Living Through The Battle of the Blues (1 Kings 19) Even the most godly and talented people have times where they experience depression. Learning how depression happens and focusing on solutions is an art all of us need to learn in the ups and downs of life. This weekend we will see how one of the most powerful men in the Bible was taken to his knees through depression, then saw God powerfully bring him out of it. Join us for Living Through the Battle of the Blues.”
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 1: Living In Healthy Stress
item.description: GET A GRIP; Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 1: Living In Healthy Stress (Isaiah 40:28-31) Emotions are just a part of life for all of us. It is how God wired the human race. Sometimes those emotions can be our great strength but other times they can limit or even enslave our lives. Stress is a perfect example. Healthy stress gets us out of the bed and into life. It’s the negative stress that damages and even steals our strength. How do we get control of the negative stress in our lives? Pastor Mark Hartman introduces our new series in a message called, “Living In Healthy Stress.”
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 4 – How Can I Know The Bible Is True?
item.description: Why Believe? Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 4 – How Can I Know The Bible Is True? We have been addressing the top four objections to the Christian faith revealed by a national poll we had conducted. The last of those questions were about the validity of the Bible. Among the comments made about the Bible were these two: 1. The Bible has been changed so many times over the centuries how can we know what the original writings were? 2. The Bible holds some positions which are culturally offensive, like slavery. Doesn’t that prove the Bible is wrong? Pastor Mark Hartman addresses these very issues and you might be surprised about the answers.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 3 - Aren’t All Religions Valid Expressions of God?
item.description: Why Believe? Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 3 – Aren’t All Religions Valid Expressions of God? Isn’t this what many people in America believe – that all religions are valid expressions of God? The stats show that the younger the person in America the less that person actually knows about real Christianity and the more that person thinks all religions are essentially the same. The reason is because that is what the popular culture teaches. But, is it true?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 2 - Why Do Bad Things Happen To Good People?
item.description: Why Believe? Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 2 - Why Do Bad Things Happen To Good People? Why do bad things happen to good people? This is an issue that believers and unbelievers alike struggle with. Pastor Mark works through some very helpful information in processing through this difficult question in the second message of our series: WHY BELIEVE? Engaging Tough Questions About God. Why not invite a family member or friend to come and explore this issue?
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Part 1 - How Can I Know God Really Exists?
item.description: Why Believe? Engaging Tough Questions About God. Part 1 - How Can I Know God Really Exists? How can I know God really exists? Every one of us know people who are asking this question and wanting an objective and clear answer. Pastor Mark presents some very helpful information that could help a person struggling to know for sure.
item.itunes:author: Mark Hartman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church

item.title: Surprised!
item.description: Bruce Ammons, Pastor Guest Ministries SCBC (Isaiah 55:8-9) Pastor Bruce reminds us that tithing is to teach you to always put God first in your lives
item.itunes:author: Bruce Ammons, Sugar Creek Baptist Church
